Glas Maol

Hear pronunciation Press to hear pronunciation

Glas Maol is the highest of a group of four Munros to the east of the Cairnwell Pass, and has been developed for skiing. The road gives a high-level starting point and eases the ascent of these rounded domes, though the alternative route given from Glen Isla via Monega Hill gives a much finer walk.

 You have not climbed Glas Maol.

Region: Cairngorms

Altitude: 1068 metres

Users' Rating:
  • Currently 2.77/5
Rating: 2.8/5 (137 votes cast)

You must be registered and signed-in to vote

Detailed route description and map

Glas Maol Munros from the Cairnwell Pass

Monega Hill and Glas Maol round from Glen Isla

Other routes and challenges

The first of the routes listed above the round of four from the Cairnwell Pass - can be shortened by omitting the first two Munros and climbing Glas Maol through the ski area and Meall Odhar.

Alternatively it could be lengthened to take in Tolmount and Tom Buidhe across the plateau.

Walker-friendly accommodation in the area

Braemar B&B

There are 9361 Walkhighlanders who have climbed Glas Maol. They have contributed 139 public walk reports including this summit. These are ordered below with the most popular ones first. The rightmost column shows how many summits were included in their report, which may help you to find the most relevant reports.
